DOC.brief_title: Daily Prednisone Versus Pulsed Dexamethasone Treatment-naïve Adult Patients With Immune Thrombocytopenia
DOC.detailed_description: Patients age 18 year first episode immune thrombocytopenia ( ITP ) eligible inclusion , except pregnant woman patient unable tolerate glucocorticoid . Diagnosis make treatment requirement define accord 1996 practice guideline American Society Hematology . The primary endpoint duration remission define platelet ≥50/nl . Secondary endpoint response rate , complete remission ( platelet ≥150/nl ) , cumulative cortisol equivalent dose ( potency prednisone / dexamethasone relative cortisol : x 4 / x 30 ) adverse event . During first week treatment patient receive prednisone 1 mg/kg/d . This period use confirm diagnosis identify patient ITP secondary lymphoproliferative , autoimmune ( systemic lupus erythematosus , antiphospholipid syndrome ) infectious disease ( human immunodeficiency , hepatitis C , cytomegalovirus infection ) . Patients stratified age ( cut-off : 50 year ) , gender primary versus secondary ITP randomize 1:1 daily prednisone ( arm A ) pulse dexamethasone ( arm B ) . In arm A prednisone continue 1 mg/kg/d second week . If platelet increase ≥50/nl , dose reduce < 25 mg/d week 14 < 7.5 mg/d week 20 accord step-wise reduction scheme provide protocol . In patient without response 2 week treatment , prednisone dose increase 2 mg/kg/d another 2 week , taper describe . In arm B patient receive six 21-day course pulse dexamethasone ( 0.6 mg/kg/d , day 1-4 ) . Patients fail achieve maintain remission switch alternative treatment arm ( A : response 4 week prednisone 1-2 mg/kg/d , loss response , maintenance dos exceed limit ; B : response 2 cycle , loss response ) .
